text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
five minute mug cake tutorial I'm gonna
be giving you a great recipe and showing
you how to make a really really simple
five-minute mug cake perfect for those
wintry nights and you're sitting at home
craving cake and you can't be bothered
baking a full recipe from scratch
valentine's Day is coming up so today
I'm doing a bit of a Valentine's twist
on it the things that you'll need I've
got two mugs just standard sized mugs
I've got a spatula I'm using my gorgeous
Valentine zeal of heart measuring cups
today and in those I've got some plain
flour I've got some sugar fine or caster
sugar a little bit of baking powder in
this one here I've got some whole milk
and just a little bit of oil so you can
either use canola oil or vegetable oil
I've got some chocolate chips and some
butter and this is optional this will
give you a richer cake but if you don't
have these two ingredients at home you
can leave them out you'll still get a
delicious cake it just won't be quite as
rich I've got some cocoa a little bit of
vanilla extract and an egg I've also got
some good-quality ice cream and an ice
cream scoop to serve off to the side
I've got some just some plastic wrap and
a bowl I like to mix my mug cakes in a
bowl rather than in the mug because then
I know I get the same amount of each
ingredient in each of the mugs and it
just gives you a bit nicer presentation
so let's get started this is a really
simple recipe we are literally just
gonna throw everything into the bowl all
of your quantities for this recipe are
gonna be on the my cupcake addiction
blog I will leave a link to that in the
description box below you can head to my
cupcake addiction blog.com at any time
to see that recipe in goes just a
drizzle of vanilla extract and your egg
all right so with all of your
ingredients combined it's gonna be as
simple as just mixing it all together
beautiful rich dark and fudgy just how I
like all my cakes all right now you just
want to scoop an even amount into both
those cups and do try to keep it as neat
as you can try not to get it too far at
the edges the number-one rule with this
cake don't leave any mixture in the bowl
perfect now you want to take your mug
cake and we're just going to cover them
with a little bit of plastic wrap and
this is just because otherwise I found
the mixture boiled up over the top and
kind of made a mess out of the muck
so by covering them just loosely with a
little bit of plastic wrap it seemed to
avoid that and it gave us a really nice
neat finish to our mug cake I'm gonna
pop those off into the microwave one at
a time mine take about one minute and
that's a regular power thousand watt
microwave on HIGH but yours may take a
minute and a half so just touch them a
little bit on top and these will
continue to cook a little bit on the
standing so less is more with these I
would be inclined to put them in for the
minute and if you really feel you need
the extra 30 seconds pop them in but you
don't want to dry them out coming back
from the microwave now after 2 minutes 1
minute each they've got your 2 mug cakes
so now to serve a good scoop of I'm
using a French vanilla ice cream bit of
your favorite flavor of ice cream pop it
in the top of that mark and as you can
see it's the perfect size to accommodate
quite a generous scooping of ice cream I
absolutely love these I love them when I
just can't be bothered and I want
dessert I just can't be bothered making
a whole one they've got your absolutely
gorgeously delicious decadent chocolate
mug cakes let's scoop in and see how

have enjoyed this video as much as I've

thanks very much for tuning into my
